alert.note: Alert for Kent; Muskegon; Newaygo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 11:47AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Kent, southern Newaygo and Muskegon Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1146 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lakewood Club to near Roosevelt Park to 24 miles west northwest of Grand Haven. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grand Rapids... Muskegon... Newaygo... Walker... Muskegon Heights... Sparta... Fremont... Roosevelt Park... North Muskegon... Whitehall... Montague... Lakewood Club... Ravenna... Fruitport... Grant... Norton Shores... Dalton... Croton... Holton... Sullivan... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Michigan.
